document.docTitle: Mysmenopsis otokiki Dupérré & Tapia 2020, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Megadiverse Ecuador: a review of Mysmenopsis (Araneae, Mysmenidae) of Ecuador, with the description of twenty-one new kleptoparasitic spider species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Megadiverse Ecuador: a review of Mysmenopsis (Araneae, Mysmenidae) of Ecuador, with the description of twenty-one new kleptoparasitic spider species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Male holotype and female allotype from Ecuador , Esmeraldas Province , Alto Tambo , Reserva Otokiki ( 00.91271 -78.57110 )
735m
,
5 Oct. 2015
,
collected in
Linothele
sp. web
, E.E. Tapia , I.G. Tapia ( QCAZ ).
Paratypes : 4♂ 7♀ , same data ( QCAZ , ZMH-A 0001890).

Additional material examined.
Ecuador : Cañar , Manta Real ( -02.54863 -79.36391 )
235m
, 3♂ 6♀ ,
17 July 2016
, in
Linothele
web, on ground between rocks
, E.E. Tapia , N. Dupérré , A.A. Tapia ( DTC , ZMH-A0001891 )
.
Etymology . The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality, Reserva Otokiki of the OTONGA Foundation.

Diagnosis. Males most resemble
M. viracocha
and
M. huascar
but can be distinguished from both species by the presence of a pointed transparent embolic apophysis ( Fig. 28 ), whereas
M. viracocha
has a large plate-like apophysis ( Baert 1990 ; fig. 3) and
M. huascar
has no apophysis ( Baert 1990 ; fig. 20); from
M. cube
n. sp. ,
see the diagnosis of the latter species. Females most resemble
M. viracocha
and
M. awa
n. sp.
but can be distinguished by the presence of an anterior rim on the epigynum ( Fig. 29 , arrow), absent in
M. awa
n. sp.
( Fig. 49 ); spermathecae in
M. viracocha
are rounded with long anteriorly oriented copulatory ducts ( Baert 1990 ; fig. 4) while
M. otokiki
n. sp.
has small oval spermathecae on a wide base with straight medially directed copulatory ducts ( Fig. 30 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 21–25.
Mysmenopsis otokiki
n. sp. ,
21, Male and female habitus, dorsal view. 22, Male abdomen, posterior view. 23, Female abdomen, posterior view. 24, Male leg I, dorsal view. 25, Female leg I, prolateral view. Scale bar: 21 – 23: 0.5mm; 24, 125: 0.1mm.

FIGURES 26–30.
Mysmenopsis otokiki
n. sp. ,
26, Male palp, retrolateral view. 27, Male palp, prolateral view. 28, Embolus and apophysis retrolateral view. 29, Epigynum, ventral view (arrow points to sclerotized ridge). 30, Internal genitalia, dorsal view (arrow points to sclerotized ridge).

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Ecuador , Cañar and Esmeraldas Provinces.

Natural history. Specimens were collected in
Linothele
webs, the species inhabit the the Andean region of Ecuador from
235– 735m
. Specimens were collected in an evergreen foothill forest on the western side of the Andes (BsPn01) ( Guevara & Morales 2013 ).
M. otokiki
is found in sympatry with
M. choco
n. sp.
and
M. awa
n. sp.
in Esmeraldas Province at Otokiki Reserve.
